results.title: Darby's rangers = The Young invaders
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, Martin Rackin and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In his first starring film role James Garner plays Colonel William Darby, an Army man in charge of organizing a group of rangers to be deployed in activities in Italy and Northern Africa. The film is chiefly presented in two parts - the preparation of the rangers, and their deployment in live action. Cast includes Etchika Choureau, Jack Warden and Edward Byrnes.

results.title: Dans les Caves du Fort D'ivry
results.brief_description:
This documentary made for television is part of a series about the treasures of the cinematheques. This episode deals specifically with the Army film archives held in the vaults of the Ivry Fort (outside Paris), whose aim is to preserve the audio-visual memory of all wars.

Credits: Director, Rene-Jean Bouyer.

results.title: Danny's egg
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Michael Midlam and PBL Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Danny, a young boy living in an Australian country town, who discovers a emu’s egg and sets about ensuring that it hatches. Danny is thwarted by the school mischief-maker but manages to incubate the egg. Provides a delightful look at the diverse skills required of the country teacher and the lifestyle of country schoolchildren. Written by David Haythornthwaite from a story by Jim Badger. Cast includes Ken Talbot as Danny. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Dangerous liaisons
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Hank Moonjean, Norma Heyman, NFH Productions, Lorimar Film Entertainment and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Valmont (John Malkovich) can’t resist. Wealthy, alluring Merteuil (Glenn Close) has challenged him to seduce the beautiful and very proper Madame de Tourvel (Michelle Pfeiffer), a task involving Valmont’s favourite pastimes, love and revenge. What’s more, Merteuil offers herself as the ultimate prize. So let the game begin. The unspoken rules to this contest of sinful pleasures are second-nature to rakish Valmont. Lie, cheat, deceive, debauch, double-cross, betray. But do not fall in love. The story comes from the frequently banned 1782 novel “Les Liaisons Dangereuses” written by Choderlos De Laclos, and was transformed into an international stage success by Christopher Hampton who then fashioned the play into an Oscar winning movie script. The luxurious setting is pre-French Revolution, but the characters could step into the dog-eat-dog nineties without skipping a beat.

results.title: Dangerous game
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hopkins, Basil Appleby, Judith West, Virgo Productions and Quantum Films
results.brief_description: Dangerous game is director Stephen Hopkins’ debut feature film but he is better known for his later features “Nightmare on Elm Street 5”, “Predator 2”, “Lost in space”, “Blown away” and several TV productions, including “24”. This Australian thriller, set in Sydney, centres around a group of five uni students, David (Miles Buchanan), Jack (Marcus Graham), Tony (John Polson), Kathryn (Kathryn Walker) and Ziggy (Sandie Lillingston) whose lives are suddenly turned upside down when they decide on a whim, late one night, to break into a department store - just for the sheer thrill of it all. What they were unprepared for, however, was the presence of Murphy (Steven Grives) the psycho cop who had, for reasons of his own, taken to stalking and harrassing Jack, pursuing him in a menacing, almost fanatical, manner to such a point that he lost his job that very day through Jack reporting him. Now Murphy is the security guard in the department store and he wants revenge. From a fairly slow start, the film gradually builds up into an action thriller with some tense moments and unexpected outcomes. Based on an original script by Michael Ralph, screenplay by Peter West and cinematography by Peter Levy.

results.title: Jane Eyre. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Julian Amyes, Barry Letts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Charlotte Bronte’s novel stars Timothy Dalton as the brusque Mr. Rochester and Zelah Clarke as the small but ‘independently spirited’ Jane. Jane leaves Lowood school, a charitable institute where she has spent the last eight years of her life, and secures a position at Thornfield Hall as a governess - in the employ of the mysterious Mr. Rochester.

results.title: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Greg Brenman and LWT
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton stars as Charlotte Bronte’s young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, who takes the position of governess to the daughter of the mysterious Edward Rochester (Ciaran Hinds), master of a large and eerie house on the Yorkshire Moors - Thornfield Hall. Will she receive the same harsh treatment she has always known as a child - or will she find the love she has always longed for? And what dark secret lies hidden at the top of the house? Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Timia Berthome and Blanche Ingramas. This made for television feature is the tenth screen adaptation of the famous novel.

results.title: Dangerous ground
results.creator_credit: Darrell Roodt, Ice Cube, Gillian Gorfil and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: After being in exile and living in America for the last 14 years, Vusi Madlazi (Ice Cube) returns to South Africa for his father’s funeral and discovers that South Africa has fallen into the hands of drug baron’s and gang violence. Following his father’s funeral, Vusi’s mother informs him that his brother Steven is missing, feared to be in trouble with one of the major drug baron’s‘s, Muki (Ving Rhames). Along with his girlfriend, Karin (Elizabeth Hurley), Vusi sets out to find his brother in Johannesburg. Together, they discover Stephen has become addicted to crack, owes Muki $45,000 and the debt needs to be paid or else Vusi will end up burying his brother as well.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Dyson Lovell, Flach Film, Cineritmo and Rochester Films
results.brief_description: Jane Eyre has lived a sad life since she was orphaned as a child. Shuffled between relatives and boarding school, she has never really known love. However, when she takes the job of governess to the illegitimate ward of nobleman, Edward Rochester, she experiences warmth and security for the very first time. When she and Rochester fall in love and he proposes marriage, it seems that finally, she will know happiness - until a devastating secret threatens to destroy the one thing she so desperately desires. Cast includes William Hurt, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Joan Plowright, Anna Paquin and Elle MacPherson. This is an enthralling love story based on the classic novel by Charlotte Bronte.
